summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between attorneys from Winston & Strawn LLP (representing a client, likely Ghislaine Maxwell) and federal prosecutors from the SDNY regarding a grand jury subpoena dated July 5, 2019. The emails primarily concern scheduling meetings and calls to discuss the client's potential cooperation, including a voluntary interview, and touch on evidence such as threatening communications and phone records.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.role: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP, Defense Attorney
persons.context: Lead attorney representing the client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in communications with the SDNY prosecutors, coordinating meetings and discussing legal strategy, including a potential proffer agreement.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.role: Associate Attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: Associate attorney at Winston & Strawn copied on emails, involved in scheduling and confirming meetings with the SDNY prosecutors.

persons.name: Cristina Isabel Calvar
persons.role: Associate Attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: Associate attorney at Winston & Strawn involved in email correspondence and scheduling discussions with the SDNY prosecutors.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on the defense of their client in the SDNY investigation.
Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP collaborating on the case, with Calvar assisting in communications and scheduling.
Both are associate attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP involved in the same legal matter.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The SDNY issued a grand jury subpoena, which is the subject of the entire email chain, compelling testimony or evidence.

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Initial date the client was subpoenaed to appear before the grand jury; later adjourned/held in abeyance pending discussions.

events.title: Proposed Meeting Dates
events.description: Multiple emails discuss scheduling a meeting between defense attorneys and SDNY prosecutors for late August 2019 to continue discussions and an attorney proffer.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting
events.description: A meeting was finally scheduled for November 26, 2019, at 2:30 pm between the defense team and SDNY prosecutors.

locations: 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP office)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (SDNY Office)
keyFacts: The emails reveal negotiations for a voluntary interview/proffer session between SDNY prosecutors and a client represented by Winston & Strawn LLP, strongly suggested to be Ghislaine Maxwell.
Prosecutors reference possessing contemporaneous telephone records from a cell phone registered to the client, showing calls with multiple underage girls.
The defense attorney mentions the client's husband receiving threatening communications, indicating potential witness intimidation concerns.
The original grand jury subpoena appearance date of July 24, 2019, was held in abeyance while discussions about cooperation took place.
The correspondence shows extensive and detailed scheduling efforts over several months, highlighting the active pre-indictment phase of the SDNY investigation in late 2019.
